DOC.brief_title: Acute Kidney Injury and Renal Recovery After Cardiac Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: Acute kidney injury (AKI) occurs in approximately one-third of patients undergoing cardiac surgery (CS), and represents one of the most significant negative predictors of patient outcome in this population. The investigators sought to examine the prevalence of AKI, renal recovery and development of de-novo chronic kidney disease in all patients undergoing cardiac surgery (elective/emergent) at San Bortolo Hospital, Italy during November 2014 - October 2015.
DOC.criteria: Adult cardiac surgery 1. Missing data for baseline serum creatinine (defined as a serum creatinine value within 90 to 365 days prior to surgery) or missing serum creatinine values >3 months after surgery (minimum two values) 2. Stage 5 chronic kidney disease (estimated glomerular filtration rate <15 ml/min/1.73 m2 or receipt of chronic dialysis)
